comment: Goodwin grades on the basis of growth and progress as a writer and student instead of assignments and cumulative scores. He will believe in you without question, even if/when you first approach him 6 weeks behind. Not an Easy or Free-A by any means, but after 32 drafts of essays and extended Office Hours at least twice a week, he will not fail you.

If you have the chance to take him for Modern World History(ENGL 2110)I would DEFINATELY take him. I have been at Kennesaw State for 3 years now and I have not found many teachers i like, but he's amazing. HE is super sweet and caring and yes attendance is mandatory, but if you email him about not being able to make it to class he is very flexible!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Goodwin is great. He is very flexible about deadlines if you are struggling or have a lot going on, just make sure you talk to him. He says you need the textbook, but I really haven't used it. He gives great feedback and is really helpful f you get stuck in your writing. While you have limited absences he has bonus attendance days to help

Signed up for a different prof but glad I got him instead. He cares a lot about his students and wants them to succeed. He will work with you concerning grades and deadlines. We wrote a 15-20p paper and he made it as easy as possible. He gives great feedback. 10/10.

If you go into his class feeling like a terriblee writer, you'll eventually come out with a lot of growth. He works with you and always offers great advice for when you're stuck. I really enjoyed his class and feel a lot more confident in my writing.

My brother and I both had him this semester. Both agree he's the best Prof we've had at KSU. He really cares about each student and works with you individually to write the best papers you can. He cares about growth (not just the grade). We had some great class discussions. Definitely recommend him! Great guy!

One of the best English teachers I've ever had. He thoroughly explains what he expects for each paper and gives additional feedback if needed. He is also extremely flexible with deadlines if you give him advance notice. The only problems is he sometimes forgets to open the submission box for the papers and takes a while with grading.

It's so easy to tell that Professor Goodwin cares about his students. There was one big research paper we pretty much worked on all semester. He gives excellent feedback and never let me stress about being a little behind on my paper. Very understanding.

Attendance is mandatory, he talks all the time, and the only "paper" we had was a 15-20 page research paper along with a 10 source annotated bibliography that we didn't start until halfway through the semester. He is lenient with timelines but he expects a lot from every student when we have other classes to do work for.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's really willing to work with each student individually. The entire semester was working on one research paper (15-20 pages). He's very kind and understanding.

have a couple of quizzes on books read, sometimes posted late. a lot to read don't get behind but wikipedia is fine to get by don't have to actually buy any book. very excited and doesn't let students talk so talk fast or tell him you haven't finished talking
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The class is easy and you will pass if you do the work. He is horrible at communication though and does not put in grades. He gives you assignments and never posts a link to upload them to. If you email him expect to not get a response.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: such a great professor. ive learned more from him about how to write a paper than 12 years in grade school. you only write 1 paper and its 15 pages but you work on it the entire semester and he teaches you how to do it step by step. very nice and caring professor. so if you cant find an easy professor hes not bad to take at all
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Overall great teacher and person. Essays aren't hard topics just follow the rubrics. One of the best professors I've had so far at KSU.

Professor Goodwin was easily the best professor I have had at Kennesaw State. Do the readings, take the quizzes, participate in class discussions, and you will easily make an A. No complaints-great professor.

It was his first semester teaching so he had some difficulties uploading and grading assignments but eventually got the hang of it. He is very caring and willing to work with anyone. Workload is light consisting of just weekly quizzes and two projects. Just make sure you read, show up to class, and contribute to in-class discussions. 10/10 recomend

I took a risk and signed up for an unassigned teacher. When I met Mr. Goodwin, I knew my risk payed off. He is such an amazing teacher and person. This was his first year teaching so he had some technical difficulties but was very understanding. If you miss a quiz, he opens it back up for you. You do have class discussions so make sure you read.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Would take again

comment: The grades are made up of 5 essays, participation and the final portfolio. He's very understanding and flexible with due dates and is always down to help you if it is needed. Sometimes the lectures can drag on but, its not too bad. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS
